poem:
### The Recipe (For Celebrations in the Park)

Garlic whispers in June's soft green,
Fusilli catching sun-dappled dreams.
Wine stained laughter lifts spirits high,  
As basil leaves wave their goodbyes.
Parmesan flakes like first snow fall,
Enough for all, for big and small.
In this brief feast, life tastes divine,
Where oil and laughter intertwine.
